required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Epothilone Plus Capecitabine Versus Capecitabine Alone in Patients With Advanced Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Trial of Novel Epothilone BMS-247550 Plus Capecitabine Versus Capecitabine Alone in Patients With Advanced Breast Cancer Previously Treated With or Resistant to an Anthracycline and Who Are Taxane Resistant

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if BMS-247550 added to the approved therapy of capecitabine is better than capecitabine alone in shrinking or slowing the growth of the cancer in women with metastatic breast cancer who are resistant to taxane and received anthracycline chemotherapy. The safety of this treatment will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival (PFS) Per Independent Radiology Review Committee (IRRC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
primary_outcome.description: PFS defined as the time in months from randomization to date of progression. Patients who died without a reported prior progression were considered to have progressed on date of death; those who didn't progress or die were censored on date of last tumor assessment. Median PFS time with 95% CI estimated using the Kaplan Meier product limit method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with best response of "Complete" or "Partial" according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) a 4-item scale wherein complete response=disappearance of all target lesions and partial response=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Computed for all patients with a best response of "Partial" or "Complete" per RECIST (a 4-item scale as described in previous outcome measure), calculated from the time when these criteria were first met until the first date of documented progression or death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: Time to response was summarized using descriptive statistics and was defined as the time from first dose of study treatment until measurement criteria were first met for Partial Response or Complete Response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of randomization until death
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from randomization to death. Participants who did not die at the time of the analysis were censored at the latest follow-up date. Median OS with 95% CI was estimated using the Kaplan Meier product limit method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: safety was assessed on a continual basis every cycle while on-treatment and every 4 weeks post treatment until toxicities resolved or were deemed irreversible.
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory values, adverse events, and other symptoms were graded using the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTC) Version 3.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptom Assessment Score Changes From Baseline for Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Breast Symptom Index (FBSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and prior to each 21-day cycle of treatment, and at first posttreatment follow-up assessment.
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life, as measured by the FBSI, an 8-item, participant-reported instrument to measure symptoms. Each item has 5 possible responses ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much). The scoring was conducted according to the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy manual, Version 4; higher scores reflect fewer symptoms.

intervention.description: Ixabepilone - Intravenous Solution, IV 40mg/m², Day 1 every 21 days, Until progression/unacceptable toxicity Capecitabine (Active Comparator) - Tablet, Oral, 2000 mg/m², Bid Days 1-14 every 21 days, Until progression/unacceptable toxicity
Tablet, Oral, 2500 mg/m², Bid Days 1-14 every 21 days, Until progression/unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
- Patients must have received either 2 or 3 prior chemotherapy regimens including adjuvant or neoadjuvant therapy.
- Prior treatment must have included both an anthracycline (i.e., doxorubicin or epirubicin) and a taxane (i.e., paclitaxel or docetaxel).
- Patients must have received a minimum cumulative dose of anthracycline or must be resistant to an anthracycline.
- Patients must be resistant to taxane therapy.
- Patients may not have any history of brain and/or leptomeningeal metastases.
- Patients may not have CTC Grade 2 or greater neuropathy (motor or sensory).
- Patients may have not have had prior treatment with an epothilone and/or capecitabine (i.e., Xeloda)

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

results_reference.citation: Thomas ES, Gomez HL, Li RK, Chung HC, Fein LE, Chan VF, Jassem J, Pivot XB, Klimovsky JV, de Mendoza FH, Xu B, Campone M, Lerzo GL, Peck RA, Mukhopadhyay P, Vahdat LT, Roché HH. Ixabepilone plus capecitabine for metastatic breast cancer progressing after anthracycline and taxane treatment. J Clin Oncol. 2007 Nov 20;25(33):5210-7. Epub 2007 Oct 29.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Still on Treatment as of CSR date

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Karnofsky Performance Status
measure.description: Karnofsky Performance Scale Index measures a patient's functional impairment: 100-80=Able to carry on normal activity and work, no special care; 70-50=Unable to work; able to live at home and care for most personal needs with assistance; 40-0=Unable to care for self; institutional or hospital care needed. Score reported in multiples of 10.

measure.title: Visceral Disease in Liver and/or Lung

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) Per Independent Radiology Review Committee (IRRC)
outcome.description: PFS defined as the time in months from randomization to date of progression. Patients who died without a reported prior progression were considered to have progressed on date of death; those who didn’t progress or die were censored on date of last tumor assessment. Median PFS time with 95% CI estimated using the Kaplan Meier product limit method.
outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: PFS was analyzed on all randomized patients on an intention to treat basis.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS) Per Independent Radiology Review Committee (IRRC)
measure.description: PFS defined as the time in months from randomization to date of progression. Patients who died without a reported prior progression were considered to have progressed on date of death; those who didn’t progress or die were censored on date of last tumor assessment. Median PFS time with 95% CI estimated using the Kaplan Meier product limit method.
measure.population: PFS was analyzed on all randomized patients on an intention to treat basis.

analysis.groups_desc: Study required 615 events to achieve 90% power to detect a hazard ratio of 0.77 using a 2-sided α = 0.05 log-rank test. The analysis was a comparison between the 2 treatment arms using a 2-sided α=0.0483 log-rank test (adjusted for an interim analysis using the O’Brien Fleming spending function) to reject the null hypothesis of equality of progression free survival. The analysis was conducted when 639 events (310 in combination:329 in capecitabine) were observed from the 752 randomized patients.
analysis.p_value_desc: Test was stratified by 1) presence of visceral metastases in liver or lung, 2) minimum of either doxorubicin 420 mg/m2 or epirubicin 360 mg/m2, and relapse > 6 months in adjuvant setting, and 3) prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease. (yes/no)
analysis.method_desc: 95.17% confidence interval is adjusted for the interim analysis.

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) Per IRRC
outcome.description: Participants with best response of "Complete" or "Partial" according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) a 4-item scale wherein complete response=disappearance of all target lesions and partial response=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions
outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: The analysis of ORR was conducted on all randomized patients on an intent to treat basis.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) Per IRRC
measure.description: Participants with best response of "Complete" or "Partial" according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) a 4-item scale wherein complete response=disappearance of all target lesions and partial response=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions
measure.population: The analysis of ORR was conducted on all randomized patients on an intent to treat basis.

analysis.groups_desc: The study had 95 percent power to detect a significant difference in ORR if the true response rate was 32 percent in the combination arm and 20 percent in the capecitabine arm.

outcome.title: Duration of Response Per IRRC
outcome.description: Computed for all patients with a best response of "Partial" or "Complete" per RECIST (a 4-item scale as described in previous outcome measure), calculated from the time when these criteria were first met until the first date of documented progression or death.
outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: Results for duration of response apply to only those subjects with a response (defined as complete or partial response).

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Duration of Response Per IRRC
measure.description: Computed for all patients with a best response of "Partial" or "Complete" per RECIST (a 4-item scale as described in previous outcome measure), calculated from the time when these criteria were first met until the first date of documented progression or death.
measure.population: Results for duration of response apply to only those subjects with a response (defined as complete or partial response).

outcome.title: Time to Response Per IRRC
outcome.description: Time to response was summarized using descriptive statistics and was defined as the time from first dose of study treatment until measurement criteria were first met for Partial Response or Complete Response.
outcome.time_frame: based on assessments every 6 weeks while on treatment until documented disease progression/unacceptable toxicity
outcome.population: Results for time to response apply to only those subjects with a response (defined as complete or partial response)

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Time to Response Per IRRC
measure.description: Time to response was summarized using descriptive statistics and was defined as the time from first dose of study treatment until measurement criteria were first met for Partial Response or Complete Response.
measure.population: Results for time to response apply to only those subjects with a response (defined as complete or partial response)

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from randomization to death. Participants who did not die at the time of the analysis were censored at the latest follow-up date. Median OS with 95% CI was estimated using the Kaplan Meier product limit method.
outcome.time_frame: from date of randomization until death
outcome.population: Overall survival was analyzed on all randomized patients on an intent to treat basis.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: OS was defined as the time from randomization to death. Participants who did not die at the time of the analysis were censored at the latest follow-up date. Median OS with 95% CI was estimated using the Kaplan Meier product limit method.
measure.population: Overall survival was analyzed on all randomized patients on an intent to treat basis.

analysis.groups_desc: Study required 631 deaths to achieve 80% power to detect a Hazard ratio of 0.8 using a 2-sided α = 0.05 log rank test. The analysis was a comparison between the 2 treatment arms using a 2-sided α=0.05 log-rank test to reject the null hypothesis of equality of survival. The analysis was conducted when 639 deaths (318 in combination:321 in capecitabine) were observed from the 752 randomized patients.
analysis.p_value_desc: Test was stratified by presence of visceral metastases in liver or lung (y/n), minimum of either doxorubicin 420 mg/m2 or epirubicin 360 mg/m2, and relapse > 6 months in adjuvant setting (y/n), and prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease (y/n).
analysis.method_desc: Test was conducted at the α=0.05 level and no adjustments were performed.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence Interval adjusted for interim analysis.

outcome.title: Treatment-related Safety Summary
outcome.description: Laboratory values, adverse events, and other symptoms were graded using the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTC) Version 3.0
outcome.time_frame: safety was assessed on a continual basis every cycle while on-treatment and every 4 weeks post treatment until toxicities resolved or were deemed irreversible.
outcome.population: All treated participants; all participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.Participants with baseline hepatic impairment (combination arm, n = 29; capecitabine arm, n = 35), defined as Grade ≥2 AST, ALT or Grade ≥1 total bilirubin, were contraindicated due to disproportionate number of toxic deaths.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone in combination with capecitabine (combination group): Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each cycle only, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) (2000 mg/m2 daily dose) x 14 days, followed by 1 week of rest.

measure.title: Treatment-related Safety Summary
measure.description: Laboratory values, adverse events, and other symptoms were graded using the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTC) Version 3.0
measure.population: All treated participants; all participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.Participants with baseline hepatic impairment (combination arm, n = 29; capecitabine arm, n = 35), defined as Grade ≥2 AST, ALT or Grade ≥1 total bilirubin, were contraindicated due to disproportionate number of toxic deaths.

class.title: Deaths on-study or within 30 days of last dose

outcome.title: Symptom Assessment Score Changes From Baseline for Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Breast Symptom Index (FBSI)
outcome.description: Quality of life, as measured by the FBSI, an 8-item, participant-reported instrument to measure symptoms. Each item has 5 possible responses ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much). The scoring was conducted according to the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy manual, Version 4; higher scores reflect fewer symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and prior to each 21-day cycle of treatment, and at first posttreatment follow-up assessment.
outcome.population: Analysis was conducted on all randomized participants on an intent to treat basis.(Note: while table only reports data up to 24 wks, which represents most results, statistical analysis includes ALL assessments through study and follow-up; a few participants were assessed after more than 100 weeks.)

group.title: Ixabepilone + Capecitabine
group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m2 administered as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle, plus oral capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 twice a day (BID) x 14 days

measure.title: Symptom Assessment Score Changes From Baseline for Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Breast Symptom Index (FBSI)
measure.description: Quality of life, as measured by the FBSI, an 8-item, participant-reported instrument to measure symptoms. Each item has 5 possible responses ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much). The scoring was conducted according to the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy manual, Version 4; higher scores reflect fewer symptoms.
measure.population: Analysis was conducted on all randomized participants on an intent to treat basis.(Note: while table only reports data up to 24 wks, which represents most results, statistical analysis includes ALL assessments through study and follow-up; a few participants were assessed after more than 100 weeks.)

analysis.groups_desc: There was a statistically significant difference between groups in change from baseline FBSI score favoring capecitabine. A mean change from baseline of 2.5 was considered a clinically meaningful difference (minimally important difference or MID). On-treatment mean changes in the FBSI did not reach the MID in either group.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial’s primary publication.
